origination.corpname: University of Michigan. Associate Director of Nursing

did.unittitle: Associate Director of Nursing (University of Michigan) records 1951-20021976-1996
did.abstract: The Associate Director of Nursing is a position in the University of Michigan Hospital. The collection ranges from 1951 to 2002 but the bulk of the material is between 1976 and 1996. Records contain materials from two Associate Directors: Sally Sample and Sue McMahon.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Collection was donated by University of Michigan Associate Director of Nursing (Donor 2289) in 1995, with additional accessions received periodically.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The University of Michigan Associate Director of Nursing record group includes restricted material in the following categories:

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Associate Director of Nursing (University of Michigan) records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Associate Director of Nursing is an upper-level administrative position in the University of Michigan Hospitals system. The Associate Director supervises the scheduling of the nursing staff, as well as having input into the hiring process of new nurses. They are in charge of coordinating and supervising the nurses that work in the University of Michigan Hospital as well as taking care of administrative work related to the nursing staff and patient care. They also contribute to the supervision of committees, research projects, and program proposals.

Sally Sample was appointed Assistant Dean for Clinical Affairs in 1982 and was reappointed to the position in 1984, 1985, and 1986 while she was also serving as the Associate Director of Nursing and a Lecturer of Nursing.

In 1996, Susan McMahon was recognized as having served the University of Michigan Hospital for 30 years. She worked in the division of the hospital which specialized in neurosurgery and neurology and held the administrative position of Chief Operating Officer in the University Hospital.

arrangement.p: The collection contains 2 subgroups: Sally Sample and Susan McMahon. Each subgroup has their own set of series.

scopecontent.p: The subgroups are chronological based on when the collection was donated to the Bentley Historical Library. Included is material related to the employment and function of nurses at the University of Michigan Hospitals, committee meeting minutes, documentation from the Nursing Director's Council, and information on various projects that were either being discussed or implemented during the time that either Sally Sample or Susan McMahon held the Associate Director of Nursing position.

The Sally Sample subgroup contains eleven series: Committees, Events, Faculty and Nursing Positions, Nursing Director's Council, Patient Care, Programs and Projects, Proposals, Publications, Reviews and Reports, Task Forces, and Topical Files.

The Committees series (1976-1990) covers many of the different committees, such as the Collaborative Practice Committee and the Joint Practice Committee, that Sally Sample was in charge of supervising or was a part of. Most of these files include meeting minutes and lists of committee members.

did.unittitle: Ad Hoc Committee to Establish Feasibility of Monitor Technician Program
Nursing Information Systems Coordinating Committee Meeting Minutes 1987-1989

scopecontent.p: The Events series (1982-1991) contains information on various events, such as the National Nursing Conference, the Administrative Nursing Forum, and the Administrative Nursing Retreat, that the nursing staff would have gone to wherein the events were either held at the University of Michigan or there were participants from the University.

The Nurse Employment series (1977-1989) contains information on the staff that worked under the Associate Director of Nursing. This also includes information such as classifications and descriptions for positions at the hospitals. Files also contain information on the nurse strikes in the 1980s.

did.unittitle: Contracting with Outside Agencies for Nursing Personnel 1977
Hospital Executive Board Status Report on Staff 1980

scopecontent.p: The Nursing Director's Council series (1979-1989) is primarily made up of meeting minutes and information on the council retreat. Also included are strategic plans and reports. Some of the information overlaps with topics in the Faculty and Nursing Positions series.
The Patient Care series (1977-1989) includes information on patient classification as well as proposals on changes to the structure of patient care in the hospital system.

did.unittitle: Presentation to Develop and Implement a System for Assessing and Meeting Patient Care Needs 1979
Proposal for Systems for Assessing and Meeting Patient Care Needs 1978
Proposal Systems for Assessing and Meeting Patient Care Needs 1978
Proposal to Assist in Development of a System for Measuring and Meeting Patient Care Needs 1978
Proposal to Develop and Implement a System for Assessing and Meeting Patient Care Needs--Supplement 1979
Revised Proposal to Develop and Implement a System for Assessing and Meeting Patient Care Needs 1978
Systems for Assessing and Meeting Patient Care Needs 1978

scopecontent.p: The Programs and Projects series (1978-1989) contains information on various nursing programs at the University of Michigan hospitals, such as the nurse retention program, as well as research projects.

did.unittitle: Pediatric, Perinatal, and Psychiatric Plans and Structure 1987-1988

scopecontent.p: The Proposals series (1978-1989) contains proposals for various programs and projects (for which there is no indication of whether or not the program/project was realized and are therefore not in the Programs and Projects series), as well as proposals given to foundations asking for monetary support.

did.unittitle: Development of Nurse Staffing Standards Amended Proposal 1979
Educational Services for Nursing Preceptor Proposal 1982
Nursing Target Hours of Care Proposal

scopecontent.p: The Publications series (1970-1988) contains manuals, newsletters, and other material that was written and published by the hospital system for use by the nursing staff.

did.unittitle: Home Parental and Enetral Nutrition Manual 1983
Management Modules for Nursing Services Module 2 1984
Management Modules for Nursing Services Module 3 1982

scopecontent.p: The Reviews and Reports series (1979-1989) contains nursing reports and program reviews regarding the faculty and staff as well as quality assurance reports and the results of the joint review of nursing services.

did.unittitle: Competencies of Graduates of Nursing Programs 1983
Joint Review of Nursing Services November 1980
Nursing Management Information System Final Report 1983

scopecontent.p: The Task Forces series (1981-1991) contains information on various task forces that were established under Sally Sample's term. Most files contain general information on the task force, correspondence, and names of members on the task force. There are multiple files related to the Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) task force.

did.unittitle: Computer Education Record Keeping Task Force 1989
Licensed Practical Nurse Role Definition Task Force
Management Development for Nurses Task Force 1989
Role and Utilization of Clinical Nurse Specialist Task Force Report 1983

scopecontent.p: The Topical Files series (1977-1991) contains files that did not fit in the scope of the other series. Most of this is general administrative files such as information on hospital accreditation, graduate program recommendations, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Action Plan for Minimum Nursing Data Set 1989
Course Evaluation Prospect Payment and DRG's 1983
Joint Commission on Accreditation of Hospitals 1979-1981
Joint Commission on Accreditation of Hospitals 1984
Masters of Science in Nursing Administration

scopecontent.p: The Sue McMahon subgroup contains seven series: Committees, Nurse Employment, Patient Care, Projects and Programs, Reports, Research, and Topical Files.

The Committees series (1975-1992) covers the different committees that Sue McMahon was supervising or a part of. Most of the files contain general information on the committee and member lists. Of particular note are the Hospital Data Systems Committee and the Nursing Information Systems Committee.

did.unittitle: Nursing Information Systems Coordinating Committee: Patient Care Documentation 1991
Nursing Research Review and Study Committee 1982

scopecontent.p: The Nurse Employment series (1951-2001) contains information related to the staff that Sue McMahon was in charge of supervising. The series is primarily made up of material related to the nurses working within the University of Michigan, such as workload graphs and reports, notes on staffing shortage, and information on nurse contract negotiations with the University of Michigan.

did.unittitle: Reorganization of Nursing Resources in Hospitals

scopecontent.p: The Patient Care series (1982-1992) contains primarily patient activity budgets. Within this series is a subseries entitled Patient Move Day, which contains information on the procedures, task forces, and route maps that were followed when a large portion of patients were moved to a different part of the hospital system in 1985.

did.unittitle: Maternal and Child Health Care Center Operational Narrative 1987

scopecontent.p: The Projects and Programs series (1970-1994) contains information on the programs and projects that were being worked on while Sue McMahon held the position of Associate Director. These include strategic plans for the department, the functional and space program (as well as its revision), and the nursing services 5-year plan.

did.unittitle: Establishing a Computerized Medical Information System 1980
Replacement and Renovation of Components at the Hospital 1979

scopecontent.p: The Reports series (1980-1983) contains various reports such as those regarding inpatient care, a status report for the hospital, staffing reports, and a report from the Activation Conference.

did.unittitle: Executive Board Report on Inpatient Units 1983
Inpatient Care Unites S&E Revised Report 1980
Inpatient Census System Requirements Definition Report 1982

scopecontent.p: The Research series (1971-1990) is primarily made up of surveys given to the patients and staff at the hospitals. Also included is a study on case length, faculty research, and abstracts from research being performed by graduate students.

did.unittitle: Case Mix and Length of Stay Study 1976
Kellogg Eye Center Nursing Staff Survey 1990
Results of the Advertising and Opinion Survey 1987

scopecontent.p: The Topical Files series (1960-2002) contains files that did not fit within the scope of the other series. These include information on the manual order entry and results system, newsletters and other hospital publications, conference information, and published materials.

did.unittitle: "A Nursing Perspective of the Eradication of Smallpox" 1980
"A Sensor and Monitor for the Manpower Control System" 1973
Manual Order Entry and Results Reporting Systems Phase I 1981
Manual Order Entry and Results Reporting Systems Phase II 1982
Manual Order Entry and Results Reports and Proposals 1979-1982
Manual Order Entry and Results Task Force 1981-1982
Systems and Elements Studies Work Group--Material Management 1980
